definition: an execution/to put sb to death
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned

sentences.english: His actions led to a death sentence, which was later commuted to a prison term.
sentences.chinese: 郗浩良的行動導致被判處死刑，後來減爲有期徒刑。

sentences.english: All others who found—and opened bottles—would be put to death.
sentences.chinese: 其他發現並打開瓶中信的人將會被處死。

sentences.english: If being ugly were a crime, you'd get the electric chair.
sentences.chinese: 如果長得醜是一種罪的話，那你就應該被電刑處死。

sentences.english: Huang taiji at noon on the second day if the killer is not on the monkey to justice was put to death on her.
sentences.chinese: 皇太極下旨第二日中午如果兇手還不歸案就處死玉兒。

sentences.english: Anyone who reached the age of fifty or a bit over --- he was to be done away with.
sentences.chinese: 超過五十歲包括五十歲的人，一律被處死。

sentences.english: Mr Grant prosecuted him and watched him put to death.
sentences.chinese: Grant先生對他提起公訴並最終看到他被處死。

sentences.english: Alex was sentenced to death for apostasy.
sentences.chinese: 亞歷克斯因叛黨而被判處死刑。

sentences.english: The exiles were forbidden to return at the peril of their lives.
sentences.chinese: 流放犯已被禁止返回，違者處死。

sentences.english: Therefore the Jewish leaders asked the Roman government to execute him.
sentences.chinese: 因而，宗教領袖要求羅馬政府處死他。

sentences.english: King Henry said she was unfaithful to him and eventually had her killed.
sentences.chinese: 英王亨利說安對他不忠，最後還將她處死。

sentences.english: By the term human sacrifice, we mean executing people and afterwards interring them in a pit in order to worship the ancestors.
sentences.chinese: 把人強行處死後埋入坑內祭祀祖先，稱爲人祭。

sentences.english: Eight rats in each group were sacrificed 28 days after intratracheal instillation.
sentences.chinese: 各組動物均於氣管內灌藥後第28天分別處死8只。

sentences.english: Anyone who took up arms against Libya would be executed, he warned.
sentences.chinese: 他警告說，任何反對利比亞的人都會被處死。

sentences.english: And she saw her husband, the aged Priam, dragged towards the household altar and ruthlessly  butchered there.
sentences.chinese: 年邁的丈夫皮安姆被拖到家庭祭壇殘酷地處死。

sentences.english: He was sentenced to death but was reprieved by the president.
sentences.chinese: 他被判處死刑但被總統下令緩期執行。

sentences.english: The Man condemned to die on Calvary.
sentences.chinese: 這個被定罪要被處死在髑髏地的人。

definition: to execute (a condemned criminal)
house arrest
to deport/to expel
to imprison/to lock up (in jail)
to kill/to murder
to expel (a member of an organization)/to fire (an employee)
unfettered and beyond the law (idiom); evading retribution/getting away with it (e.g. crimes)/still at large
traitor
not to shrink from any crime (idiom); to commit any imaginable misdeed
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
to conspire to murder/to plot against sb's life
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
supreme penalty/execution
to accompany/to follow/to attend/entourage/attendant
to guard/to defend
extermination of an entire family (ancient Chinese punishment)
